name: JDBC Access Must Be Protected By Retry
description: Any execution path that invokes database access using Spring JDBC must be protected by a Resilience4j @Retry boundary. Retry boundaries must not be placed below @Async boundaries.

rationale.why: Database operations are prone to transient failures. Missing retries affect system availability.
rationale.impact: Data loss, failed requests, poor user experience.

remediation.summary: Wrap the JDBC call or its caller with @Retry.
options: Ensure @Retry is above any @Async annotation in the call stack
Move recovery logic to a Facade
